titles.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 3309) to amend the Communications Act of 1934 to provide for greater transparency and efficiency in the procedures followed by the Federal Communications Commission.

Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 3309) to amend the Communications Act of 1934 to provide for greater transparency and efficiency in the procedures followed by the Federal Communications Commission.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 112-422, by Mr. Webster.
The resolution waives all points of order against the bill. The resolution waives all points of order against amendment printed in the report.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 121.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 595.
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 236 - 182 (Roll no. 130).

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 242 - 177 (Roll no. 131).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: Sets forth the rule for consideration of the bill (H.R. 3309) to amend the Communications Act of 1934 to provide for greater transparency and efficiency in the procedures followed by the Federal Communications Commission.
